annotations.title: d37 UFC 287: Pereira vs. Adesanya 2 - GAME AVENUE

textContent:
https://gameavenue.co/d37-ufc-287-pereira-vs-adesanya-2/?sport=mma

Look at how far we’ve come since the year 2000 due to computing. At the turn of the century, those were the early days of (very expensive) personal computers, the early days of the internet (on dial-up), VHS tapes (Blockbuster), overhead projectors

The technological leap from the turn of the century to present day has been gigantic. In brief we have moved from dial-up modems to technologies like starlin which provide high-speed internet connection even in the most remote regions of the globe. AI developments have championed today's breakthrough technology such as in digital art and robotic manufacturing with the most recent prominent breakthrough being the GPT-4 model. At his rate, one can imagine that in 2035 you could wake up to the sounds of birds chirping at a precise time set by your digital assistant thanks to its incessant "crunching" of variables relating to your sleep pattern. You could then move on to a level six fully autonomous vehicle which takes you to your place of choice with a guaranteed level of safety returning you home to personalised AI-generated music assisting you to a mindful end of the day knowing your digital assistant might wake you up with something new and melodious.

Today, AI is painting artwork, making music Robots are permeating all aspects of manufacturing At least one robot (Sophia) has attained citizenship.

a world of personalized medicine based on your sequence genome.AI will treat, and largely eliminate, neurological disorders like Alzheimer's, Parkinson’s, most birth defects, and spinal cord injuries as well as blindness and deafness. By 2050 robotic prosthetics may be stronger and more advanced than our own biological ones and they will be controlled by our minds.

The increased population of 2050, though mainly working from home, will still need to get around. --   the Super Cruise from General Motors, which controls the vehicle on long highway stretches when not much is happening. There is the Traffic Jam Assistant from BMW, where cars move along in a congested traffic area just like a school of fish. There’s also Road Train where one vehicle with a professional driver leads a platoon of vehicles ---These will be the bridge to 2050, when we should be at level 6, which would mean fully driverless cars.

As metaverse function grows, by 2050 it will be extraordinary by today’s standards. We will virtually be able to travel the world and innumerable custom planets, all from home. It will be our parallel life, connected via multiple devices, wearables and even our brain. It will be mixed reality.

Many people will opt to spend much of their day in virtual worlds where they can become whoever they want -- a “life” with no limits.

---
My passion lies in a conjunction of engineering and research in advanced computational technologies primarily aimed at improving the social welfare of everyday persons. A research engineering position at an organization which aims to better the lives of others gives me the certainty that I would have the determination and commitment to carry out my everyday tasks.


The technological leap from the turn of the century to the present day has been gigantic. In brief, we have moved from dial-up modems to technologies such as Starlink which provide high-speed internet connection even in the most remote regions of the globe. AI developments have championed today's breakthrough technology not only in manufacturing and health care but also in digital art with the most prominent breakthrough being the GPT-4 model we all know too well about. At this rate, one can imagine that in 2035 you could wake up to the sounds of birds chirping at a precise time set by your digital assistant thanks to its incessant "crunching" of variables relating to your sleep pattern. This data would be protected under schemes such as the GDPR used in the UK and Europe and agencies to regulate the involvement of AI in human activities such as the National Institute for Standards and Technology in North America will become commonplace.  You could then move out of your house and into a level-six fully autonomous vehicle which takes you to your place of choice with an assured sense of safety before returning home to personalised AI-generated music helping you have a mindful end-of-the-day knowing your digital assistant will wake you up with something new and melodious.


My MSc thesis which earned me a distinction is titled "Towards a clean social environment using machine learning" and is an NLP model which utilises sentiment analysis to categorise tweets as toxic and non-toxic. The aim was to build a model to categorise hate speech but in due process, numerous discoveries were made into how internet toxicity affected different groups of people. It would be a pleasure to continue this great project with some of the brightest minds at Vertebra AI and work towards creating a clean social environment using machine learning.

Look at how far we’ve come since the year 2000 due to computing. At the turn of the century, those were the early days of (very expensive) personal computers, the early days of the internet (on dial-up), VHS tapes (Blockbuster), overhead projectors


The technological leap from the turn of the century to present day has been gigantic. In brief we have moved from dial-up modems to technologies like starlin which provide high-speed internet connection even in the most remote regions of the globe. AI developments have championed today's breakthrough technology such as in digital art and robotic manufacturing with the most recent prominent breakthrough being the GPT-4 model. At his rate, one can imagine that in 2035 you could wake up to the sounds of birds chirping at a precise time set by your digital assistant thanks to its incessant "crunching" of variables relating to your sleep pattern. You could then move on to a level six fully autonomous vehicle which takes you to your place of choice with a guaranteed level of safety returning you home to personalised AI-generated music assisting you to a mindful end of the day knowing your digital assistant might wake you up with something new and melodious.

a world of personalized medicine based on your sequence genome.AI will treat, and largely eliminate, neurological disorders like Alzheimer's, Parkinson’s, most birth defects, and spinal cord injuries as well as blindness and deafness. By 2050 robotic prosthetics may be stronger and more advanced than our own biological ones and they will be controlled by our minds.


The increased population of 2050, though mainly working from home, will still need to get around. --   the Super Cruise from General Motors, which controls the vehicle on long highway stretches when not much is happening. There is the Traffic Jam Assistant from BMW, where cars move along in a congested traffic area just like a school of fish. There’s also Road Train where one vehicle with a professional driver leads a platoon of vehicles ---These will be the bridge to 2050, when we should be at level 6, which would mean fully driverless cars.


As metaverse function grows, by 2050 it will be extraordinary by today’s standards. We will virtually be able to travel the world and innumerable custom planets, all from home. It will be our parallel life, connected via multiple devices, wearables and even our brain. It will be mixed reality.


Many people will opt to spend much of their day in virtual worlds where they can become whoever they want -- a “life” with no limits.


---

My passion lies in a conjunction of engineering and research in advanced computational technologies primarily aimed at improving the social welfare of everyday persons. A research engineering position at an organization which aims to better the lives of others gives me the certainty that I would have the determination and commitment to carry out my everyday tasks.



The technological leap from the turn of the century to the present day has been gigantic. In brief, we have moved from dial-up modems to technologies such as Starlink which provide high-speed internet connection even in the most remote regions of the globe. AI developments have championed today's breakthrough technology not only in manufacturing and health care but also in digital art with the most prominent breakthrough being the GPT-4 model we all know too well about. At this rate, one can imagine that in 2035 you could wake up to the sounds of birds chirping at a precise time set by your digital assistant thanks to its incessant "crunching" of variables relating to your sleep pattern. This data would be protected under schemes such as the GDPR used in the UK and Europe and agencies to regulate the involvement of AI in human activities such as the National Institute for Standards and Technology in North America will become commonplace.  You could then move out of your house and into a level-six fully autonomous vehicle which takes you to your place of choice with an assured sense of safety before returning home to personalised AI-generated music helping you have a mindful end-of-the-day knowing your digital assistant will wake you up with something new and melodious.



My MSc thesis which earned me a distinction is titled "Towards a clean social environment using machine learning" and is an NLP model which utilises sentiment analysis to categorise tweets as toxic and non-toxic. The aim was to build a model to categorise hate speech but in due process, numerous discoveries were made into how internet toxicity affected different groups of people. It would be a pleasure to continue this great project with some of the brightest minds at Vertebra AI and work towards creating a clean social environment using machine learning.
